page.name: home
page.title: rfk86
page.p: This is a port of the robotfindskitten game for the TI-86 graphing calculator.

To use, trans-re-mogrify the supplied rfk86.86p into your calculator by some unspecified means, then invoke Asm(rfk86) or use some sort of shell. Use clear (or many other keys) to get past the introductionary splash screen, the arrow keys to move the eponymous, cubical robot, and the exit key to escape, if the suspense is too much for you.

Kittens have eaten the developer's link cable, so this application has been so far tested only with an emulator. It is very likely to work on a real calculator, but if it breaks, you have to fashion a modernist sculpture out of both pieces.
For the latest word in TI-86 kitten-finding, see the git repo.
You may also peruse the legal disclaimer.

page.name: devel
page.title: rfk86 // developer's corner
page.p: There is a Makefile in the source package. You will need the z80asm tool (in Debian/Ubuntu, the z80asm package) to assemble the code, and a reasonable Perl installation to run the build scripts. The GD Perl module is also needed, to convert the PNG source images.
